title: I cannot fucking stand when junglers get to camp top unanswered.
body:
For fucks sake i played a game of morde top where i shat on irellia she litterally ended the game doing 9000 damage. But i lost because their jungler ganked top 12 fucking times and we still got less drakes then them even when im begging for my team to do the dragon. Im gonna take a break because that is the most frustrated i have been on this account ever. 

But for fucks sake if their jungler is camping the living fuck out of top making the lane a fucking 2v1 then do the dragon please or fucking abuse mid and bot lane you dont even need to get a kill just bully them. Or take their junglers farm please dont let me get camped to the point of not being able to farm but not punish their jungler from being away from everything actually relevant. You dont even need to be good at jungle because if their jungler is always in one lane your free to abuse and farm the bottom half of the map.

Its so fucking frustrating i actually want to puke because its a shitty tactic that is easily exploited and only works if the other jungler refuses to use fucking logic. Im way more mad then i should be but that last match was fucking idiotically frustrating and pointlessly lost. And im really fucking mad that i didnt play it better.

replies.body: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wXMD6wmcwvE
aint my name cool ?

> [{quoted}](name=Relax I am noob,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=5ubNceOG,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2019-06-14T22:03:20.731+0000)
>
> Better jungler wins

This sentiment is so true. The jungles is a supremely important role

yeah,and junglers complain that their role got "destroyed" (aka they can't 1 vs 9) by jungle xp nerfs

and the worst part is that is that your team will even start to blame you with stupid things like "just ward" when the guy is literally coming to poke you under your own tower and putting himself between you and your minions so you can't farm

right??!?

*is getting poked/dove constantly by 2 people*

"jUsT wArD!!!!!!"

> [{quoted}](name=wildfox9T,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=5ubNceOG,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2019-06-14T22:29:02.349+0000)
>
> yeah,and junglers complain that their role got "destroyed" (aka they can't 1 vs 9) by jungle xp nerfs
> 
> and the worst part is that is that your team will even start to blame you with stupid things like "just ward" when the guy is literally coming to poke you under your own tower and putting himself between you and your minions so you can't farm

I mean most of the reason these 6 ganks strat top or bot in a row with no compensation from the enemy jungler work is because no one wants to play jungle rn, so there are far fewer actual experienced junglers in bronze-gold elo meaning someone is inevitably getting filled jungle and just farming the game away while having negative game impact

SOoooo the jungler dictates the entire game, is what your saying.... because that literally what you just said.
I mean, if a bad support mid or top or adc are on you team, its workable, but the filled jg "farming the game away while having negative game impact" is detrimental to his team, takes farm from his team, and feeds while also giving away pressure.

Careful, don't say anything or the jungle mains will come here to tell you that it's not the junglers job to win your lane and then will disregard any logic you use

uwu just ward uwu

> [{quoted}](name=General Esdeath ,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=5ubNceOG,comment-id=0006,timestamp=2019-06-14T23:55:47.812+0000)
>
> Careful, don't say anything or the jungle mains will come here to tell you that it's not the junglers job to win your lane and then will disregard any logic you use
> 
> uwu just ward uwu

As an ex JG main and a current top lane kench abuser i can assure that your junglers were correct and if you listen learn JG pathing you will be 1 division higher within a week.

> [{quoted}](name=BestPudgeNA,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=5ubNceOG,comment-id=00060000,timestamp=2019-06-16T04:38:52.739+0000)
>
> As an ex JG main and a current top lane kench abuser i can assure that your junglers were correct and if you listen learn JG pathing you will be 1 division higher within a week.

I can tell you play jg since you don't know that wards don't protect you from tower dives or being zoned
Top lane is JG difference.

To be honest camping a lane wouldn't be so effective if time wasted not farming camps was a trade off at all. Nerfing jungle camp exp means sapping lane exp is the superior option, so might as well camp that lane as well.

> [{quoted}](name=1800NICECLIENT,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=5ubNceOG,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2019-06-14T22:18:32.883+0000)
>
> To be honest camping a lane wouldn't be so effective if time wasted not farming camps was a trade off at all. Nerfing jungle camp exp means sapping lane exp is the superior option, so might as well camp that lane as well.

If you gank too much you can actually fall behind in levels. It's a double edged sword because you can be several kills ahead but if your laner makes nothing of those leads down the line the enemy jungler starts being able to invade you by outleveling you and the other lanes that are doing well easily shut you down.

In fact, one of my pet peeves as a jungler is when I'm like 5/1 by minute 6 and my teammates keep pushing needless fights when I need to get around to clearing my camps, because team fights are always a gamble and even if we win it, if I die during that teamfight I'm falling further and further behind in xp if the enemy jungler is being smart and taking advantage to counterjungle.

Take your ganks when they come and let the jungler at least clear most of his camps before you choose to get caught out 4v5.

I don't think laners understand how reliant on staying up to date with the camps a jungler is for not becoming lower level than even the bot lane.

I used to main mid lane and totally get the hate for afk farm junglers, but laners do this crap as well where I'm contesting a crab, or my jungle gets invaded, or I'm warding off the enemy jungler from collapsing on my bot lane via tri bush and all my bot lane does is stay farming minions while their team rotates onto me. So I understand when junglers choose to just farm when it's obvious all of the lanes either always push to turret, making them ungankable, or they play completely passive and don't force engagements when you're arriving, so you go in and get killed first because they took too long staring before they engage with you.

AFK farm laners exist as well.

No, if you FARM you fall behind in levels, if you GANK you put both laners (top and enemy top) behind in levels as you get ahead.
Ganking is the superior farming strat now because if you "accidentally" kill the entire minoin line with your q e on vi *cough, you get 2 full camps worth of XP.

> [{quoted}](name=Eonslegacy,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=5ubNceOG,comment-id=000100000001,timestamp=2019-06-16T07:37:21.438+0000)
>
> No, if you FARM you fall behind in levels, if you GANK you put both laners (top and enemy top) behind in levels as you get ahead.
> Ganking is the superior farming strat now because if you "accidentally" kill the entire minoin line with your q e on vi *cough, you get 2 full camps worth of XP.

There is no guarantee of a kill in a gank. If I put my top laner behind in xp that's actually worse since most meta top laners scale far better than any meta junglers. Jax, Irelia, Riven, Tryndamere, Fiora, hell even a Poppy who's ahead serves as a better tank than my Volibear or any other jungler champ for that matter, and who end up doing more damage by far.

My job as jg is to beat up my enemy jungler by contesting river or invading them to remove pressure from the map and get just enough ganks to get my lanes ahead without falling out of relevance myself.

I also like to stay caught up in farm because there will be games where all your solo laners can't win lane on their own, so you will be forced to babysit some lanes so much and they won't even do anything with it that you might as well not let your enemy jg invade your jg for free to get massively ahead in levels.

Soooo. jax cant jg? Or tryndamere? or poppy? i mean just becasue your playing unmeta weak champs in the jg, and not applying early game pressure isnt our bad mate.
Also, arent i putting the enemy behind also? like thats the point, your not sabotauging your laner by annoying theirs the levels your guys give up arent nearly as high as the gold they give up being forced to recall 2 times in 5 minutes with 25 farm to your laners 60. Im sorry but if jax has a tforce and is lvl 5, he beats a lvl 6 darius with phage.

> [{quoted}](name=Eonslegacy,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=5ubNceOG,comment-id=00010000000100000000,timestamp=2019-06-17T08:20:40.118+0000)
>
> Soooo. jax cant jg? Or tryndamere? or poppy? i mean just becasue your playing unmeta weak champs in the jg, and not applying early game pressure isnt our bad mate.
> Also, arent i putting the enemy behind also? like thats the point, your not sabotauging your laner by annoying theirs the levels your guys give up arent nearly as high as the gold they give up being forced to recall 2 times in 5 minutes with 25 farm to your laners 60. Im sorry but if jax has a tforce and is lvl 5, he beats a lvl 6 darius with phage.

They can, but all of those have far less healthy clears and they're essentially scaling junglers that are pretty weak to early skirmishes and contests by champions like lee sin, xin zhao, volibear, Olaf, reksai and even a hecarim with conqueror. Usually jg champs are niche picks with good ganking toolkits that can supplement a role like tank or assassin, but couldn't cut it in actual lanes. Camille, Wukong, Hecarim, all could be top laners but they get trounced in top lane by the meta top laners, so they're taken jungle where they are less likely to get stat checked since jg spend less time fighting each other than laners do. Khazix couldn't hope to lane mid at all against another assassin.

A top laner doesn't have to waste an item slot on smite enhancements. A jax top is substantially better than a jax jg. And a Jax won't have triforce by lv5 unless he's massively fed.

Just because their jungler is camping top, doesn't mean the enemy bot lane isn't stomping your bot lane 2v2, leaving your jungler unable to take drag, or gank without your mid laner getting involved as well.

Then the question arises: wtf is your jungler even doing?

If bot isnâ€™t winning, mid isnâ€™t winning, top is being camped with no answer and no jungle objectives are being taken, what use are they to your team?

If winning bot isnâ€™t an option. And if winning mid isnâ€™t an option. And if taking jungle objectives isnâ€™t an option...

Maybe just come top?? Like fuck, i have to ask my junglers these questions every other game. Like we arenâ€™t playing chess here. Thereâ€™s 3 lanes and ganking 2 of them isnâ€™t working. Maybe, just maybe, gank the other one???

> [{quoted}](name=Z3Sleeper,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=5ubNceOG,comment-id=00030001,timestamp=2019-06-15T14:32:48.360+0000)
>
> Then the question arises: wtf is your jungler even doing?
> 
> If bot isnâ€™t winning, mid isnâ€™t winning, top is being camped with no answer and no jungle objectives are being taken, what use are they to your team?
> 
> If winning bot isnâ€™t an option. And if winning mid isnâ€™t an option. And if taking jungle objectives isnâ€™t an option...
> 
> Maybe just come top?? Like fuck, i have to ask my junglers these questions every other game. Like we arenâ€™t playing chess here. Thereâ€™s 3 lanes and ganking 2 of them isnâ€™t working. Maybe, just maybe, gank the other one???

He's farming because he CAN'T do anything else in your scenario, and that's why JG is the most auotofilled/hated role right now.

What happens is, if top lane is getting camped, then that lane is not possible to gank because of the damage in League it will be a double kill for the enemy team because they are ahead from the previous ganks. This is amplified by the fact that even though 3/10 times a gank could work, if it doesn't the other 7/10 because of what I said above, you get flamed as-if you had any control over the lvl 9 irelia 2 shotting the lvl 7 jg.

So then you try to focus mid/bot, but your bot lane is also getting smashed and has 30%hp while the enemy has full hp, so you can't help there either which leaves mid. A very hard lane to gank most of the time and rarely successful unless they have no sums.

That is the current state of JG right now. Helping someone behind in lane is a very precarious decision that more times than not leads to a grey screen for the JG and the enemy getting a double-kill, especially if there is a counter gank.

Having said all that, I usually DO still try to help if the stomping isn't too bad. However, if it doesn't go well I won't be back the rest of the game.

Hereâ€™s the thing, a lane being camped and a lane being killed are two separate things.

The scenario is enemy jungler is camping top but the top laner is playing smart and not dying to ganks but he also canâ€™t get a lead because itâ€™s essentially a 2v1 lane. Basically the lane is in a position where a single gank could turn the tides but it never comes cuz his jungler is focusing on mid and bot and absolutely failing as they fall further and further behind.
Assuming that last parts even occuring lol.

> [{quoted}](name=PhearBunny,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=5ubNceOG,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2019-06-14T22:31:39.444+0000)
>
> Just because their jungler is camping top, doesn't mean the enemy bot lane isn't stomping your bot lane 2v2, leaving your jungler unable to take drag, or gank without your mid laner getting involved as well.

Uh, most junglers can solo drag by level 4-6 and as long as your bot lane is somewhere in their lane and not dead, if top is getting camped and mid is even or pushed out, then you have a good chance at doing so safely
Literally every single of my games.

She actually got most of her kills around bot and dragon pit, so I don't think it is fair to say that she was camping top. She was just putting in some work and it was paying off. 

It be like that sometimes
Amount of kills does not equal amount of ganks.

That wasn't my point. 

She was clearly ALSO putting pressure on the bottom lane. 

So she wasn't camping you.... She was doing her job.
She went bot once and got a quadra kill. Kills do not equal the amount of pressure put on a lane.

Alright, just watched that match. 

Gank #1, Death #1, Game time ~3:30 .. During the trade with Irelia just prior to the gank, you blew flash and did not respect the fact that you no longer had any summoner spells, and had no vision. Irelia pinged your flash in chat (which I understand that you wouldn't know) and Vi immediately came top to gank you while you were over extended with no means of escape. Granted, you did almost make it out, but if you had warded river (trinket ward was on cooldown) or just recognized that you didn't know where Vi was and played safer, .. you WOULD have made it out. 

Meanwhile, Vi had not ganked anywhere else. 

Gank #2, Time 6:20 .. After you died earlier, Irelia had shoved and backed as soon as you got to lane. You caught the wave and started to push out, and as soon as Irelia returned, you were super aggressive right away. You did get a kill (your second on Irelia), which I do understand because you win trades against her, .. BUT, you still have no summoner spells, and still no vision in the river. The whole time Irelia is respawning, you are pushed to tower, again, with no idea where Vi is. She waited for Irelia to get back and came up the river again. AS SHE SHOULD! ... Easy kill #2

Irelia shoves and attempts to roam mid. You see her on Evelynn's Pink in the river. Good pings to warn Talon. Gotta commend you on that. 

Talon, escaping toward Evelynn decides to take scuttle and both go bottom lane, which looks like a good call. Jhin and Leona do appear to be over extended on vision and Trist + Yuumi are there to pincer. 

Unfortunately, Vi, with 2 kills and a hefty amount of farm just made it to the bottom lane, split the Evelynn off while she tried to flank, Talon over-committed while Trist under-committed. .. And Vi picked them off one by one for, .. as you said, a quadrakill. 

Now Vi is 6/0/0 at just over 8 minutes into the game. .. And nobody .. hell, ON EITHER TEAM, .. is a close contender. 

Oh, and during all of this, you got a mutual kill with Irelia. 

On respawn, you teleported out to a pushing wave .. ? Okay... Oh, and yay, you put a control ward in the river! 

You fight, ult, and kill Irelia, .. then you're back to wailing on the tower. You do have that control ward, but other than that, you still have no idea where the fed Vi is. .. Turns out she's top side. Gank #3 top lane (#4 overall for Vi) at about 9:40 that control ward comes in handy. You start to back off, but you half fight her for some reason, despite being on half health. I guess you might have noticed that she hasn't bought any items since her quadrakill, so maybe you think you can take her since she's got a lot of gold doing nothing for her and you're the same level. .. Turns out, no... Fortunate for you, she doesn't clear your ward. .. Unfortunately, she's backing right by it to cash in on a full Trinity Force. 

She returns to bottom lane for a kill, then Talon thinks he can 1v3 for some reason, .. +2 more for Vi. At this point, towers don't mean much to her (she is a diver after all) but Trist does manage to get a shutdown on her. 

Unfortunately for you, Irelia is now able to win trades with you. Then Evelynn comes in to clean up. You were almost respawned, so I guess that doesn't REALLY absolve her of the "unanswered" charge. 

14:00, and Gank #4 top. .. Your control ward IS still in the river bush. You even have vision of Vi with it, but you still think you should start trading with Irelia. You do have Flash up, maybe you're safe. .. Hm, .. you aren't even trying to retreat. .. Maybe you figure you just all in and trade 1 for 1, ... You do almost get Irelia, .. buuut, .. no,.. she Flashes out and Vi cleans up. 

If you weren't already tilted, which that play screams "TILTED" .. You are sure to be after this point, .. so I'm going to stop with the play-by-play at this point. 

Speaking of tilted, .. you might be seething with me at this point. I hope you're not, honestly. .. because there is a lesson to be learned here. It's pretty healthy to watch your gameplay videos and learn from them. It's also healthy to take constructive criticism. (I'll apologize now, because I'll admit, I have been a tad snarky, and it's not the best way to GIVE constructive criticism) So here it is. 

In this game, I'm not watching your others (unless you want me to) you showed a tendency to be overly aggressive when you have no vision or safe means of escape, which is practically ringing the dinner bells for junglers. 

Now, I get it, Morde is a monster, and that early showing of power makes you think he can snowball right away. He is also new, so it isn't easy to know when he falls off, and how hard. Also, your teammates made some major mistakes, and Vi happened to be there to capitalize on them. THAT'S NOT YOUR FAULT. In fact, if she wasn't so fed, it looked like you might be the one to carry your team, which is all the more reason for you to be more cautious. 

Hope this wasn't totally infuriating, and you find it at least somewhat helpful. 

Peace

Also, your teammates made some major mistakes, and Vi happened to be there to capitalize on them. THAT'S NOT YOUR FAULT. I mean this is gold. I dont think top laners ever rly play around jg matchup or pathing knowledge. But in OPs defense if the jgs skill levels were closer eve couldve done something with the pressure vi exerted top. But the eve was a 40% silver in a gold game, with no eve games played, and only positive winrate being on lulu... 

Its not effective at all to focus on how bad ur teammates are, but sometimes in solo q the matchmaking is pretty absurd.

So the meaning of the story is, Dont fight laners you beat, because you MIGHT get ganked, give up all lane pressure, sit under turret, dont farm because you might get dove, dont even play the matchup, give up everything if enemy jg is not in vision, and meanwhile, irelia CLEARLY was willing to fight him and force his flash, so CLEARLY, she didnt respect enemy jg so why is his jg not there to counter?
The problem is simple, eve didnt gank durign the 6 mins vi ganked, vi got a lead, and wasnt put behind for ganking, Vi beat eve in power, even tho eve farmed strictly to GET power, eve didnt win 1v1, vis ganks single handedly won the game for their team, and eve wasnt useful at all to their team. im sorry but jg dictated that game entirely, yet mid isnt(assasin reworks and mage update) allowed to do that, top isnt(irelia/jax nerfs/toxic design rework), adc isnt(nerfs to most adc/redesigns/releases that hunt adcs down) and support isnt(ardent meta), so why is jg constantly allowed be so oppressive.(lvl 3 ganks turn to lvl 2 ganks)

... What?

No, .. did you read what I said? I understand, it's a long comment, but I never said anything about not fighting. I even said, "I understand why you would want to be aggressive" and "You were most likely to carry" 

My point was that when they were out of position with low health, no vision, and no escape tools. Morde is super immobile unless he has his passive, which requires that he be in a fight, and against a fed Vi, his passive wouldn't be enough. 

The point was, it was their aggressiveness that encouraged Vi to gank. It was their lack of vision that lead to the Vi getting an early lead. IT WAS ALSO their teammates poor decisions that further put Vi ahead. Then it was their continued lack of respect for Vi's strength that allowed her to repeat gank again and again. 

And again, THEY WERE BEING OVERLY AGGRESSIVE and constantly pushed into the enemy tower, which made it practically impossible for Eve to gank top. The only time she was able to come top and get a kill was after Morde died and Irelia continued to push while she was low health. 

I'm definitely not saying that nobody else on the team contributed to the loss, .. but Morde certainly wasn't without blame, and it WAS their actions that caused the things they are complaining about.

Furthermore, their actions are the only things they have any control over. By identifying your bad habits, you can prevent someone else from taking advantage of them.

You could freeze the wave outside of your tower and play safe to waste the enemy junglers time which is a solid tactic. However, you are correct in saying that your jungler should be capitalizing on the position of the enemy jungler and taking free jungle camps from them and objectives like dragon or tower by forcing 2v1 or 3v2's on the map.

you can't always freeze under your tower and have an even lane

now that's not the case but if you have a  scaling monster you lose your lane by freezing,or even worse when you are in a melee/low range vs ranged/high range you're pretty fucked at this point because you will get constantly poked and harrassed,forcing you to either go back often for your low HP and mana (losing tons of CS and tower platings and having your jungler getting invaded and killed) or getting dived after they poke you down (some junglers come even if they can't kill you,just to annoy and make you waste something)

it's fine as general tip but most of the times it won't prevent you from falling behind if your jungler is literally afk in his jungle

I to play aatrox jg and walk into enemy top laner playing safe and push WQ just to do 400 damage and then leave. oh unless im lvl 6 then i push R wq and do 600 damage and possibly just straight up dive/kill them. 10/10
you...you are evil {{sticker:sg-syndra}}

> [{quoted}](name=Ravenous Howls,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=5ubNceOG,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2019-06-14T22:33:33.237+0000)
>

A good jungle will just lane gank. Now you have two situations: you try and keep the freeze but you have to threaten them off the wave (which opens you up to dying to the lane gank). Or let the enemy shove the wave under your tower, which will bounce back and open you up to a lane gank. 

Yeah... and jungler doesnâ€™t lose shit for camping your lane cause camps are worthless.

Junglers being able to camp any lane without getting any disadvantages other than leaving the other lanes without support is a whole problem by itself too. Before, a camping jungler would just keep the enemy laner from farming until he is under turret, and thats it. Nowadays, even an underleveled jungler in a serious gold disadvantage has enough damage/mobility to instantly kill a flashless laner who is 3 seconds away from his turret, with or without the ally laner depending on how busted the jungle champion is.

Looked through your history, found the game in question. Do you want to know what I noticed?

You died 6+ times damn near under their tower. With the 'farthest' away being at the very edge of their side's lane brush (closer to their tower), so still substantially past the middle of the lane.

Now sure, Irelia died a lot, but you kept over-extending to get those kills. Against a jungler you knew wanted to gank you, who your jungler could not fight. Your vision profile leaves a lot to be desired too. Only one red ward, at nearly 9 minutes, on like your third back? C'mon dude.
